page.title: 06Garton C.E. School
page.content: The school was built in 1843 on land leased from Sir Tatton Sykes, a local landowner and farmer. It is a single storey, red bricked building. It comprises of three classrooms,a mini hall/dining room, cloakroom and kitchen. There is a small playground but no games field. In 1984 the whole school was upgraded and extended. The school is in a quiet,peaceful position opposite the church and surrounded by fields. The school usually has about 50 children drawn from Garton and nearby villages.There are 3.1 teaching staff and 7 ancillary staff. The children study the usual school subjects and pursue integrated studies in the form of topics. Children work at their own speed and are given individual attention. The school is well provided with books and equipment.
